    ImpreciseLerp(in double, in double, in float)

    Imprecise method, which does not guarantee v = v1 when t = 1, due to floating-point arithmetic error.
    This method is monotonic. This form may be used when the hardware has a native fused multiply-add instruction.

    Declaration
    public static double ImpreciseLerp(in double a, in double b, in float t)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    double a

    Value at t=0
    double b

    Value at t=1
    float t

    Time value, a being 0, b being 1
    Returns
    Type Description
    double

    A value between a and b
    | Edit this page View Source

    PreciseLerp(in double, in double, in float)

    Precise method, which guarantees v = v1 when t = 1. This method is monotonic only when v0 * v1 is smaller than 0.
    Lerping between same values might not produce the same value.

    Declaration
    public static double PreciseLerp(in double a, in double b, in float t)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    double a

    Value at t=0
    double b

    Value at t=1
    float t

    Time value, a being 0, b being 1
    Returns
    Type Description
    double

    A value between a and b
